Position Purpose:
As a Data Scientist in the Enterprise Analytics and Data Science team at Petco, you'll work on projects to discover insights that will drive strategic decision-making and optimization for our customer membership programs. These insights will be generated through advanced customer analytics and the development of machine learning models.
Essential Job Functions:
Develop complex data analysis, methodologies, and predictive data models for assessing customer behaviors.
Review historical data, identify trends and make recommendations for specific business questions.
Create new data pipelines as needed to integrate multiple databases at Petco.
Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering specific questions or improving system performance.
Utilize code (Python/SQL) for data analyzing and modeling algorithms.
Apply statistical or machine learning knowledge to specific business problems and data.
Conduct written and verbal presentation to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication.
Conducts tracking and measurement of KPIs related to recommendations and socializes to the broader teams.
Provide requirements to develop analytic capabilities, platforms, and pipelines.
Other Duties and Responsibilities
Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests.
Independently prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks within established timeframes.
Perform other related duties, tasks and responsibilities as required, assigned and directed.
Education and Experience
Advanced degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Economics or related field
Candidate must possess strong analytics capabilities and have at least 2 years’ experience in business analytics or data science
Proficiency with SQL and multiple analytics tools required; Python or R strongly preferred
Hands on experience with BI tools; Tableau /R shiny/Looker
Must be self-driven and passionate about retail and must be customer centric
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Ability to explain/present complicated/advanced analytical methodology and results to non-technical audiences
Excellent communication skills as well as quantitative modeling, statistical analysis skills and problem-solving skills

Position maintains quality and financial dashboards for the Pharmacy Department including development and maintenance of data visualizations using Tableau software. Supports pharmacy residency programs by building reports and providing data analysis and benchmarking in support of medication use evaluations and research.

Presentation experience
Proven record of committee/team participation
Demonstrated analytical experience working with clinical data
Experience working in a large, complex healthcare provider organization
Possess the personal characteristics of professionalism, credibility, commitment to high standards, innovation, discriminating judgment and accountability

Masters degree.
Leadership experience in either a committee or work team.
Medication-use evaluation experience.

Identifies work flow and business process requirements and related solutions over a complete business process including obtaining approvals, documentation, testing and training. Considers the business implications of work flow and processes to the current business environment.
Conducts business process evaluations, interviewing internal and external customers, to gain technical knowledge of business requirements.
Identifies problems, researches alternatives, prepares presentations, drives solutions, tests to confirm, gains consensus, and implements solutions for multiple processes within multiple functions.
Create reports; research and analyze data and report trends and vital information to management/business partner.
Troubleshoots a wide variety of complex problems and identifies solutions within broad application and functional expertise.
Mentors and advises less experienced Business Analysts, monitoring project status.
Actively contributes to the results of a team and works towards achieving team goals and objectives.
Uses expertise of more senior level Business Analysts and leverages a wide range of additional resources to define complex business processes crossing functional areas.
Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry practices and established policies and procedures.
Regularly makes recommendations to department processes.

Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate
Intermediate understanding of SQL and MS Office
Strong interpersonal skills
Able to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced, deadline driven, highly technical environment

2+ years of directly related experience.

Strong written and oral communication skills in order to define business and technical parameters and lead team to meet business requirements.

PURPOSE OF THE JOB
The purpose of this job is to work closely with business leaders and provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and business trends to improve outcomes. This position will complete analysis of various complex data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams to meet the business and financial goals of the Company. This position exists to drive solutions which require bringing together enterprise-wide data from multiple data sources, creating visualizations, and using analytics techniques to solve and support complex business problems.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects and aggregates data from multiple internal and external sources for analyses to drive insights into business performance.
Aggregates large, complex data sets from multiple databases and creates reports and dashboards.
Collaborates with appropriate parties within the organization to integrate new data sources into our existing data infrastructure.
Delivers complex and actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems.
Designs, builds, tests, and maintains reports and dashboards and identifies potential improvements to existing business intelligence, reporting and data analysis.
Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers.
Collaborates in cross-functional teams to implement analytical solutions.
Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team.
Analyzes current business processes; makes recommendations to management for new, more efficient, workflows, and processes.
Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives.
Validates data delivered to user community. Ensures compliance with Company data and software policies and procedures.
Provides reporting solutions and responds to report requests across multiple business areas and for complex enterprise-wide projects.
Collaborates with team members across the organization to identify and understand business problems and processes.
Enhances and develops analytical and reporting solutions to solve business problems and extract insights.
Enhances and supports enterprise-wide strategies, processes, and standards for business intelligence and reporting.
Delivers complex functional specifications and system design specifications for assigned projects.
Defines and develops new business intelligence capabilities that provide business with new insights for their external clients and internal operations.
Engages with key stakeholders to define and adopt data analytics methodologies and standards.
Serves as the subject matter expert for the department.
Trains staff on project deliverables and acts as a resource for colleagues in the department to answer questions and solve complex problems.
Conceptualizes and proposes reporting solutions to business leaders throughout the organization.
Provide training materials, documentation, and suggestions to Enterprise Data Analytics leadership staff concerning data analysis and reporting.
Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team.
Develops functional specifications and reporting design specifications for assigned projects.
Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provides data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of business initiatives.
Mentors team members in the use of Business Intelligence tools and applications.
Manages initiatives in data management, business intelligence and analytics, supporting existing and planned activities within its business unit as well as the broader organization.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This role does not have supervisory responsibilities.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science required and Minimum of 7 years of technical experience in analytics, data science, actuarial or equivalent quantitative field required. Minimum 5 years of experience with SQL, Power BI and SAP Business Objects BI required. 5+ years’ experience with Alteryx or other ETL tools preferred.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None required.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

Ability to communicate effectively, especially in a cross-functional team setting. Ability to effectively present analysis to ICW staff and external audiences. Ability to establish trusted relationships with key internal customers is required. Ability to thrive in a fast paced and changing work environment. Training and mentoring of junior staff is required. Familiarity with business operations in the property casualty insurance industry is preferred.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Office environment – no specific or unusual physical or environmental demands and employees are regularly required to sit, walk, stand, talk, and hear.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
This position operates in an office environment and requires the frequent use of a computer, telephone, copier, and other standard office equipment.

positionName: Sr. Analyst, Tableau and Business Intelligence
description:
Senior Analyst - Tableau and Business Intelligence
Job Overview:
The Senior Analyst, Tableau and Business Intelligence, Business Insights & Systems, Relationship Management plays a critical role of helping to enable Relationship Managers across Independent Advisor Services (IAS) and Institution Services (IS) support over 10,000 financial advisor, and more than 800 financial institutions who utilize LPL’s industry-leading customer and investment technology to manage their businesses and support their clients. Relationship Management plays a key role in driving a curated care experience by helping advisors and institutions navigate the many service and product offering LPL brings to market in ways that help them manage and grow their practices and assist clients in making their financial dreams possible.
Business Insights & Systems is responsible for creating data-driven and actionable insights which inform executive actions and direct advisor engagement through the use of Tableau dashboards, Salesforce, and the production of standardized performance reporting. With IAS and IS leadership, Business Insights & Systems drives the execution and measurement of key initiatives around advisor/institution retention, AUM growth, net sales performance, as well as creating leads and referrals for customizable solutions available across the LPL platform.
Additional responsibilities include:
Serve as primary reporting liaison within Business Insights for the Elite Relationship Management team which supports the largest and most complex Advisor teams. This includes the development of Tableau dashboards and data capture from Salesforce, NPS, financial, and service disciplines to measure engagement, satisfaction, economic performance and utilization of LPL services and capabilities.
Track and report on progress towards key strategic initiatives, metrics, and OKRs, including recommending prescriptive actions to course correct where necessary.
Lead the data management and reporting relationship with external vendor ActiFi, and their advisor success platform which LPL uses to help advisors identify and achieve their growth and practice management goals.
Develop Salesforce and Tableau dashboards to enable self-service of key client insights, client engagement targets, targeted campaigns, and business referrals.
Design and develop meaningful insights for Relationship Management. Prepare and distribute reporting packages and dashboards to senior management with a focus on expediency, data accuracy, and informed narration.
Effectively translate business needs into reporting requirements and partner with user groups to identify and mitigate risks or impacts, leveraging a team of champions for user acceptance testing and process improvement ideation.
Lead work-streams for key initiatives; provide guidance to cross-functional teams and act as a voice of Relationship Management for firm-wide initiatives.
What are we looking for?
We are looking for an energetic and collaborative team player who is driven to make a difference for the home office, and regionally-based Relationship Managers we support. We’re looking for someone who can help us innovate and improve our user’s Tableau literacy by creating powerful interactive dashboards while making it easier for them to use, and delivering a streamlined, customized experience.
Qualifications:
This role is Tableau, Salesforce, reporting, and data management intensive. The ideal candidate will come with the following:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, CS, Mathematics, or a related field.5+ years of experience in an Asset or Wealth Management organization or comparable.Highly proficient in Tableau including dashboard creation and report development.Experience using Python, Alteryx or Tableau Prep for powering queries and data preparationExpert level in Excel, including vlookups, pivot tables, complex formulas, and charts. VBA is a plus.Experience, and a high level of proficiency with Salesforce.Ability to demonstrate critical, analytical thinking in all aspects of the job – technical and non-technical.Familiarity with the agile project management framework.Project and change management experience is highly valuedComfort with data management, transformation and governance best practices.
Please note – This position is expected to work in an LPL home office location on a full time or hybrid (3 days in office, two days remote) basis. Full time remote is not an option once LPL return to work protocols resume in early 2022.

Job Summary

The Strategic Insights and Analytics manager is an essential role within our Corporate Strategy organization. This role is an individual contributor and will is responsible for supporting key strategic initiatives across functions that drive strategic outcomes for the organization . The individual will report to the VP, Corporate Strategy and Global Strategic Initiatives, but must work cross-functionally with teams from Go-To-Market, Marketing, Product Management & Engineering, Finance, and others .

The role will be responsible for delivering on key activities related to strategic programs in a timely and efficient manner. Given the ambiguous nature of the strategic challenges that may arise, this role needs to be comfortable with uncertainty and willing to dive into new and undefined problems . By conducting internal and external research, and identifying relevant data, the role will support in assessing and quantifying different strategic paths and evaluating go-forward options . This will require strong problem-solving skills and motivational drive to step into unchartered territory. By supporting strategic initiatives, this role will work on tasks that shape company and functional operating models and define future needs and execution plans. This role will be essential in translating complex business situations and the corresponding analysis into easy to consume presentations targeted at multiple levels in the organization, including peers and executives. This role requires balancing and influencing multiple competing priorities and individuals.

Primary Responsibilities:
Support management in strategic, operational planning and execution of tasks in line with Teradata’s overall direction and strategic goals
Define scope and drive critical projects and initiatives partnering with cross-functional teams across the organization
Deep dive to understand business problems in depth and leverage a data-driven mindset to research and gather insights on key strategic questions
Bridge the gap between technology teams and the business, especially when communicating requirements and determining optimal solutions
Collect & analyze data, information, and research (e.g., market data, competitive analysis, etc.) through quantitative and qualitative mechanisms to make decisions on critical strategic issues
Frame and break down complex business problems into key components, design analysis to drive insights and answers to critical questions, and recommend practical solutions to get results
High levels of problem solving to identify creative and novel solutions
Apply storytelling and communication skills to effectively craft presentations for all audiences (individual contributors, line managers, and top executives)
Design and develop Power BI reports, dashboards and dataflows
Provide oversight and guidance on projects of high importance
Develop collaborative relationships with key stakeholders across the company and represent the strategy organization with cross-functional teams
Ability to balance and influence multiple competing priorities and individuals

Foresee and highlight organizational risks and take preventative action where possible .

Minimum Requirements & Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or other STEM field
Strong analytical background with 5-7+ years of experience

Experience in driving insights using visualization and analytics tools
Experience using Power BI or similar BI tools
Advanced SQL writing capabilities and expert Excel knowledge
Strategic thinker with ability to effectively manage ambiguity
Demonstrated passion and depth of understanding for technology solutions

Detailed and process oriented; with ability to work on both strategic and tactical initiatives
Proven ability to quickly build rapport and credibility with multiple stakeholders across the organization
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), with the ability to tailor materials to executive audiences
Proven project and time management skills with ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to balance and influence multiple competing priorities

Demonstrate personal and professional values consistent with Teradata’s values

Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture Salesforce team, where you’ll:
Expand your experience with over 200 intelligent tools across all 12 Salesforce-recognized industries.
Join in the development and implementation of new Salesforce-based solutions.
Benefit from our long-standing partnership with Salesforce to access the coolest Salesforce technologies, like Lightning, Einstein and Bolt, so you can put them to meaningful applications at scale.
Join more than 11,800 skilled Salesforce professionals, collaborating across multiple areas to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.
Build new skills and strengthen your expertise with unparalleled training and support—whether you're taking the more than 4,200 unique Salesforce certifications or working towards your Certified Technical Architect (CTA) certification.
Join Accenture and be empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community.
Job Description
The Salesforce Senior Business Analyst is a key member of our Delivery organization in the US. In addition to being responsible for business analyses, the BA would work directly with the project team and clients gathering requirements to analyze, design and/or implement technology best practice business changes. They work with senior members of the team ensuring the successful delivery of Salesforce.com implementation. They should have solid function and/or industry knowledge, as well as Salesforce products such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Marketing Cloud.
They enhance Accenture’s marketplace reputation. Our clients are work leading organizations that are/have selected Salesforce.com to advance business and the Consultant is an essential team member inside the organization.
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. When/if travel resumes, travel for this role is expected to be 50% or less.

Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from several infectious disease experts.
Typical Day Snapshot
Work with Delivery Lead/Project Manager to maintain and coordinate communication with the customer/client throughout each project.
Work with Delivery Lead/Project Manager to maintain and coordinate communication with the customer/client throughout each project.
Mapping functional requirements to Salesforce.com features and functionality.
Understand and document requirements for configuring, testing and launching our CRM solution.
Understand CRM requirements and Identify product requirements for future enhancements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile inconsistency and break down high-level information into details.
Work with Architect and Developers to transform new requirements into Salesforce.com design and implementation.
Develop, maintain with perform processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity in platform applications with Salesforce Administrator and functional managers to create training materials and documentation for Salesforce.com users and help train new end users on Salesforce.com and related applications.
Configure Users, Profiles Role Creation/Maintenance, Custom and Formula Fields, Validation Rules, Page Layouts and List Views, Assignment/Auto Response/Escalation, Workflows & Approvals and Process Builder.
Supports testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.
Supports PM with projects updates, scheduling, invoicing, etc.

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 4 years’ Business Analysis experience.
Minimum of 2 years’ as a Salesforce administrator or Salesforce App Builder.
Minimum of 2 years’ Experience implementing CRM solutions from start to finish, including the creation of business requirements and other formal documentation.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associates Degree, must have minimum 6 years’ work experience)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with sandbox and production environments to manage the distribution of system functional or process changes.

Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build, deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You’ll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel, take informed risks, and drive ingenuity across the enterprise.
Why ResMed?
ResMed is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of innovative products for the diagnosis, treatment and management of sleep and respiratory medicine. We take pride in our people: their innovation, their extraordinary passion for what we do and our opportunity to change lives with every breath.
The company has experienced sustained and significant growth since inception. One of the principal contributors to this growth is innovation reflected in a commitment to producing world-class product lines. The global competitive environment is becoming more difficult which is resulting in a greater emphasis on innovation and a cost-effective approach to achieving market leadership through technological advances.
Let’s talk about the team and you:
The ResMed Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. This role is in support of Customer Experience business units, inclusive of Sales, Customer Service, and Marketing. The Lead Business Analyst will be embedded with a dynamic, fast-paced team in IT responsible for creating and supporting complex cloud/on-prem solutions using technologies such as Salesforce CRM, AWS, Oracle ERP, Marketo, RingCentral, Tableau, Snowflake, and more. The team supports key business capabilities for ResMed including sales enablement, customer success, and marketing using these integrated systems. The candidate must demonstrate progressive leadership in business analysis and software development and possess strong knowledge of the software development life cycle.
The candidate will partner with business leaders to align IT initiatives with business strategy and provide business process and technical expertise to IT staff for the implementation, testing, and deployment of enhancements, solutions, projects, and maintenance for supported systems. The candidate will work with business stakeholders across sales, customer service, and marketing to analyze current state needs and challenges, identify improvement and automation opportunities, develop a backlog of user requirements, provide functional and non-functional expertise in identifying, evaluating and implementing process and procedures to help solve complex business problems. This candidate is a role model for other business analysts. Prior experience as a Product Owner as well as working on agile teams is highly desirable.
Let’s talk about responsibilities
Lead meetings with business stakeholders, project sponsors, and program team to identify and document business needs, stakeholder requirements, functional, non-functional and transitional requirements
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Facilitate confirmation of requirements and designs with business and technical team
Conduct user research, draft user stories and meet with product owners to validate, enhance, and prioritize them
Facilitate backlog refinement, roadmap planning and prioritization sessions with product sponsors, stakeholders, and technical staff
Evaluate different solution approaches and recommend solutions that provides business value
Provide expertise in process modeling, data mapping, user stories and use Cases
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness of existing requirements gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or furthering these processes
Improve artifacts, tools, and processes for documenting and memorializing requirements
Mentor, coach, and/or manage more junior Analysts on the team
Participate in and/or lead Center of Excellence for BA’s/PO’s
Maintain ongoing communication with business users and stakeholders to manage expectations regarding changes to the system and new functionality
Conduct weekly meetings to provide status updates and determine priorities
Collaborate deeply with Product owners, Stakeholders, Business Analysts, Developers, Test engineers, and cross-functional teams to lead end to end delivery
Assist with cocreating test plans and acceptance criteria, and executing test cases for QA and UAT sign-off
Work closely with development team for cocreating solution design, technical integrations to help drive decisions and solutions and reduce technical debt
Proactively contribute to the quality of the product by seeking and proposing new or alternate approaches to address the requirements
Participate in and/or lead sprint planning, sprint reviews, scrum meetings and other agile activities
Improve and expand knowledge and skills sets with regards to current trends and changes in business and technical domains and stay up to date with design trends
Troubleshoot and provide technical resolutions throughout product life cycle
Let’s talk qualifications and experience:
Bachelor’s Degree required; advanced degree a plus
At least 10 years proven track record as a business analyst with solid experience in business analysis planning, requirements and user story elicitation, specifying and modelling requirements, requirement life cycle management, strategy analysis, solution and design, and acceptance criteria
Excellent interpersonal verbal, oral, and written communication a must
Attention to detail, quick learner, positive attitude, self-motivated, ability to multi-task, and work in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills a must
Proven ability to prioritize, multitask, and manage multiple deliverables with changing priorities
Proficiency with various tools including but not limited to MS Office, MS Visio, Confluence, Jira
Strong understanding and experience working within an Agile software development process
Understanding and wide application of methodology and subject matter related concepts, practices, standards and procedures with a general knowledge of other related business disciplines
Prior experience working on customer-facing or customer experience projects highly desirable
Prior experience with CRM and ERP systems and databases, and custom interface development highly desirable
Desire and ability to conduct data and process analysis using a variety of query tools including SQL highly desirable
Prior experience designing, developing, or modifying business-facing reports highly desirable
Experience with different prioritization models for ROI highly desirable
Prior management experience or other experience leading a team highly desirable
Job Environment
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
ResMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority/ Female/ Disability/ Veterans.
ResMed participates in E-Verify. The Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Notice of Right to Work are available for your review.
Ok, so what’s next?
Joining ResMed is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. A role where each day you’ll uncover a new reason to love what you do. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!
Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

positionName: Senior Business Analyst – Research Administration and Compliance
description:
Job Type: Full Time

Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions. We are seeking multi-functional, experienced Senior Business Analysts that have worked in the trenches, possess strong leadership qualities, and have the ambition to keep pace with our growth trajectory. With this unique offering in a highly competitive space, we are seeking someone highly skilled to join our adventure, partner with great clients, and help us reach new heights.

We are looking for individuals with functional experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance that have been heavily involved in an IT systems implementation.

Streamlyne offers modules to support Pre-Award (including System-to-System proposal submission), Negotiations, Post-Award (including Subaward), IRB, IACUC, IBC, Conflict of Interest, and Export Control. Expertise in multiple areas is highly preferred. Candidates that have led an implementation will be given top priority consideration.

This position will be aligned with a team of like-minded multi-functional Business Analysts (BAs). Business Analysts at Streamlyne are customer-facing, play many important roles, and have significant impact on the growth of the company and improvement of its products. Senior BAs will play lead roles within team projects, including all implementations.



Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.
A fully-trained member of the BA Team is expected to contribute as follows:

Marketing Duties
Complete RFP responses and/or coordinate the assignment and management of RFP tasks with teammates.
Execute software demonstrations within your area of expertise and/or coordinate participation from other analysts in demonstrations as required.
Travel to onsite demonstrations as requested (usually with other team members), manage onsite technology, and manage prospect relationships/follow-up.
Coordinate prospect software trials and serve as point of contact for related communication.
Provide input into scope analysis and solution architecture for contract development as requested.
Travel to industry conferences and events to foster industry relationships and develop leads.
Implementation Duties
Lead classroom or remote sessions to train clients on application functionality.
Lead onsite or remote analysis sessions with clients to guide them through configuration and customization decisions in alignment with their business requirements.
Successfully distinguish user requests from true underlying needs.
Create and maintain project artifacts, such as configuration documents, business requirements documents, and functional specifications.
Identifying, delegating/executing, and tracking the results of tasks that arise out of client discussions, to include configuration tasks, testing tasks, data mapping tasks, documenting tasks, general problem solving, etc., in alignment with a defined project schedule.
Product Development Duties
Participate in the development of the product roadmap, requirements and specification documentation.
Work with development teams to translate product requirements into technical requirements.
Analyze and critically evaluate industry product information gathered from multiple internal and external sources, reconcile findings, and decompose high-level information into product details for future product improvements.
Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of any given project.
This Position Requires You To:
Be able to work at a pace required by a rapidly growing, profit-driven Ed Tech business.
Be driven to acquire and internalize new information quickly.
Possess a natural aptitude for software-supported business processes and design, to include an appreciation for formal logic and a genuine love of problem-solving.
Feel comfortable speaking in front of small and large groups of people.
Coordinate assigned work with other team members and follow up on delegated items.
Possess an intrinsic passion to pursue assigned work to the highest personal ability and integrity.
Be kind, flexible, proactive, and able to maintain productivity in the face of ambiguity.
Appreciate a fast-paced environment in which no two days are the same.
Fit into a group of highly integrated, highly communicative, fundamentally unpolitical and tightly knit but geographically dispersed team.
Proactively analyze personal progress, project progress, potential risk areas, and proactively communicate that analysis to management.
Be effective at working remotely, generally from home, serving primarily East Coast business hours but responsible for Coast-to-Coast time zones.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or 7 + years’ experience in Business Analysis.
5 + years’ experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance.
Hands on experience with a research administration system.
Active participation in at least one full-lifecycle implementation project.
Superior written and oral communication skills.
Exceptional presentation and meeting facilitation skills.
Experience with and/or demonstrated ability in working as part of a geographically dispersed project team.
First Consideration Will Be Given To Candidates With:
Hands on experience with Streamlyne, Coeus, Cayuse SP, InfoEd or Click Commerce.
Experience as lead on a Research Administration-related systems implementation.
Experience in report writing at the enterprise level.
SQL literacy.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.

JOB
This position may be filled as either an Administrative Analyst I or Administrative Analyst II depending on candidates qualifications and experience.Class specifications are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed by employees in the class. Specifications are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job. The Administrative Analyst will supervise, coordinate, and participate in various administrative operations and activities within an assigned department including procurement and contract administration, budget development and monitoring, departmental policy enforcement, and various special projects; coordinate assigned activities with other divisions, outside agencies and the general public; and perform a wide variety of professional-level research, administrative and analytical duties in support of assigned department.Administrative Analyst I - This is the entry-level class in the Administrative Analyst series. This class is distinguished from the Administrative Analyst II by the performance of the more routine tasks and duties assigned to positions within the series. In addition, employees at this level work under general supervision, receiving instruction or assistance as new or unusual situations arise. Since this class is typically used as a training class, employees may have only limited or no directly related work experience. Advancement to the “II” level is based on demonstrated proficiency in performing the assigned functions, and is at the discretion of higher level supervisory or management staff.Administrative Analyst II - This is the full journey level class within the Administrative Analyst series. Employees within this class are distinguished from the Administrative Analyst I by the performance of the full range of duties as assigned. Employees at this level receive only occasional instruction or assistance as new or unusual situations arise, and are fully aware of the operating procedures and policies of the work unit. Positions in this class are flexibly staffed and are normally filled by advancement from the I level, or when filled from the outside, have prior experience.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
The following duties are typical for this classification. Incumbents may not perform all of the listed duties and/or may be required to perform additional or different duties from those set forth below to address business needs and changing business practices.Perform professional-level federal, state, and local research, administrative and analytical duties in grant support of assigned department; select, adapt and apply appropriate research and statistical techniques utilizing institutional regulations, policies, and guidelines.Prepare analytical and statistical grant accounting reports including the preparation of conclusions and forecasts based on data summaries and other findings; consult with City staff, outside agencies and associations to obtain information on various types of grantsConduct administrative, operational and management analyses, studies and research projects; gather and analyze data; report conclusions and make recommendations in reference to various grants from all departments. .Participate in the development and implementation of goals, objectives, policies and priorities for assigned functions; recommend and implement resulting policies and procedures of grants and how they apply in finance.Provide assistance in resolving operational and administration issues; identify issues and conduct research to find alternative solutions; make recommendations; assist in implementation of grant applications.Participate in Citywide grant activities; research grant opportunities for assigned area; assist in preparing grant proposals, letters of inquiry and other grant documents; prepare grant status reports as required.Participate in the development and administration of assigned budget; collect and analyze financial data; review and analyze budget requests; create data tracking and reporting systems; monitor and approve expenditures; recommend adjustments as necessary.Oversee and coordinate departmental procurement processes for specific grants including the development of bid documents and execution of the formal bid process.Review and administer grant invoices from various departments. Ability to review supporting documentation and determine if expenses are allowable.Ensure City meets regulatory requirements as by 2 CFR Part 200, Uniform Guidance, and other applicable guidance while meeting required deadlines for grant reporting, ensuring accuracy, and fulfilling compliance.Prepare SEFA and other audit work papers as requested for external government audits. Ability to independently work with auditors in completing Single audits.Ability to do bank reconciliations and other accounting duties as required.Provide staff assistance to higher-level management staff; participate on and provide staff support to a variety of committees; prepare and present staff reports and other correspondence as appropriate and necessary.Coordinate assigned services and project activities with other City groups, boards, committees, task forces, external organizations and agencies, and the general public; respond to and resolve inquiries and complaints.Perform related duties as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be: Education/Training: Equivalent to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in a field appropriate to assigned area of responsibility that may include finance, business administration, public administration, human resources, criminal justice, or other research-intensive field. Experience: Administrative Analyst I: Some responsible administrative, analytical and/or budgetary experience including experience specific to area of assignment is desirable.Administrative Analyst II: At least two years of responsible administrative, analytical and/or budgetary experience including experience specific to area of assignment. License or Certificate: Possession of, or ability to obtain, an appropriate, valid driver's license.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Interested applicants must submit an online application, a cover letter, and supplemental questionnaire. This position is open until the needs of the City are met so interested applications are encouraged to apply immediately. Unless specifically stated otherwise in this announcement, all requirements must be met at the time of application, and all required licenses and certificates must be current and valid. Candidates whose qualifications most closely meet the needs of the City will be invited to participate in the examination process for this position. The examination process may consist of any or all of the following components: written examination, oral interview and/or practical performance examination. Eligible candidates will be notified when testing dates have been established.NOTE: Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a pre-employment medical evaluation, which may include an alcohol/drug screen.

Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.

About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements

ROLE OVERVIEW

We're seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our growing team. You'll play a critical role on our Analytics and Marketing teams, and be instrumental to driving long-term growth for the company. The ideal candidate has strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, and is excited by the opportunity to navigate large amounts of data to identify patterns, distill insights, and solve complex problems. This is a highly visible role with significant autonomy and the opportunity to work across several teams.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Play an instrumental role across various data-intensive projects: design A/B tests; use R or Python to process large amounts of prospect data; apply models to identify optimal audiences; process campaign files for execution, and analyze campaign results.
Use SQL/R/Python to collect data, visualize the situation, identify root causes, and generate recommendations.
Help drive growth across marketing channels (including Direct Mail, Google, Facebook, etc) by identifying opportunities for optimization and driving continuous improvements.
Provide analytics support to marketing and other teams: collect problem statements from main stakeholders, generate hypotheses, and draft analysis plans.
Design and build informative dashboards on the company's BI platform.

ABOUT YOU

You have a bachelor's degree from a competitive institution or equivalent professional experience. A degree in a quantitative field such as science, math, computer science, or engineering is preferred.
You have 1-4 years of experience in an analytically rigorous role. Bonus points for experience working directly on marketing and growth problems.
You're skilled at R or Python. You ideally have hands-on experience with SQL, Excel data analyses, and large datasets.
You're familiar with statistical topics including ANOVA, A/B testing, correlation, regression, etc,
You're able to think creatively and critically. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environment.
You bring strong interpersonal skills and excel in cross-functional team environments.

ABOUT US

Our Product

"Point provides the opportunity to stabilize your financial situation without adding costly monthly payments." - Homeowner in Burlingame, CA

Here at Point, we're helping homeowners unlock the equity in their homes without taking on further debt. With an investment from Point, homeowners can de-leverage and diversify their wealth, freeing them up to invest in their business, renovate and maintain their home, eliminate debt, and tackle all of life's expenses from college tuition to medical bills. Our equity investment product is an advantageous alternative for homeowners and investors alike. When partnering with Point, investors now have access to a brand new asset class - homeowner-occupied residential real estate. Point is the first fintech product that is truly aligned with consumers' interests - when the homeowner does well, Point and its investors do well.

Our Team
People first
As a consumer fintech company, we embed integrity, transparency, and trust into everything we do at Point, including how we work. Whether you're a homeowner, investor, employee, or candidate, it's people who power our business. We keep the human experience top of mind.

Experts at work
We're on a mission to help the 23 million equity-rich, but cash-constrained Americans tap into their home's wealth. To do so, we have experience and expertise in all areas of the business, especially at the helm. Point's leadership have previously founded TrialPay (acquired by Visa), Yub (acquired by Coupons.com), Metails (acquired by Buy.com), SiteAdvisor (acquired by McAfee), Affirm, SendGrid (acquired by Twilio), and TXN (acquired by Envestnet).

Championed by the best

Opportunity Overview

TuSimple's Project Analyst provides overall technical and program management support for assigned projects/programs. The Project Analyst creates and maintains project/program documentation, prepares short-term look ahead schedules, monitors and analyzes project/program risk and coordinates project/program activities, as assigned.

In this role, you will provide support to the Sensor Engineering team on project management needs. The ideal candidate would possess technical understanding of this field with a desire to grow in project management.

Join us and be a part of excellence!


Role Responsibilities

Under direction, works with project leads to prepare and update detailed project plans, deliverable timelines, KPIs and milestones.
Prepares short-term look ahead schedules, based on the master schedule, and submits to project leads for approval.
Assists with workload planning, tracking and forecasting.
Evaluates potential project risks and recommends solutions.
Researches, monitors, and analyzes data to provide business insights.
Effectively collaborates with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to monitor project KPIs, proactively overcome project challenges and assist with risk mitigation. Ensures project team members meet assigned project deliverables and deadlines.

Coordinates and facilitates meetings. Prepares agendas, presentations and all other necessary meeting materials. Takes meeting minutes and distributes accordingly.
Updates and maintains project related pages, dashboards and other relevant data.
Gathers and integrates project performance and progress information. Prepares detailed status reports which include: latest accomplishments, upcoming deliverables, project metrics and risk analysis.
Provides recommendations for improving internal processes and documents all approved process changes.
Supports project kick-off and close out activities. Collects necessary information, documentation and approvals. Provides input on lessons-learned and documents accordingly.


Experience & Skills Required

Associate's degree or above in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
1+ year(s) Project Coordination, Project Analyst or related experience
Ability to read and understand a project plan and draft a 3 week look-ahead schedule with minor edits needed.
Demonstrated ability to effectively influence for basic/routine project needs.
Ability to read and understand project documentation and update per process.
Ability read, understand and interpret project plans and documents
Strong organizational skills, ability to coordinate multiple tasks and support projects of varying complexity concurrently.
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated planning, prioritization skills and successful execution abilities.
Proven ability to work under firm deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with individuals at various levels within the organization.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders, understand and interpret stakeholder needs .
Ability to maintain steady professionalism throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progressive start-up environments.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Description
Job Description:
Leidos is currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst to support the Deployment Health Research Department at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA. This position will support the Department of Defense (DoD) Birth and Infant Health Research (BIHR) team in their goal to examine reproductive health outcomes among military families and explore possible relationships between military service and reproductive health. The BIHR databases include large consolidations of DoD administrative and medical data, which are used to identify pregnancies and births among military families and define maternal and infant health outcomes. The Data Analyst will work closely and collaboratively with senior BIHR staff to support efforts across the full research project cycle.
Due the COVID-19 pandemic, employees are highly encouraged to work remotely from their home office, although occasional visits to the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego will be required.
Position Responsibilities
Access various secondary data sources to extract relevant data and construct comprehensive, project-specific datasets
Contribute to data management processes, including data verification, cleaning, quality assurance, merging, and preparing data requests
Develop algorithms to define health outcomes based on medical codes
Use SAS to clean and analyze data and run statistical models including PROC LOGISTIC, REG, PHREG, FREQ, GLM, PROC SQL and more
Prepare tables and graphs displaying research findings
Maintain and update documentation on all processes and procedures, including data dictionaries and codebooks
Contribute to the preparation of study deliverables, including presentations, reports, and publications
Required Qualifications:
Master’s degree in public health, epidemiology, or related field
1-5 years’ work experience in public health, epidemiology, statistics or related field
Experience with research design and statistical methodology for relevant research studies
SAS competency with complex database management and data merging, cleaning and verification processes
Due to federal contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and able to obtain a Secret Clearance.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with or exposure to ICD-9/ICD-10 diagnostic coding and administrative medical claims data
Experience in maternal and infant health research
Experience using SAS to execute advanced analytic techniques (e.g., propensity score analyses)
Pay Range:

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
TuSimple Company Overview

Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.

TuSimple is a fully commercialized autonomous trucking company. As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our live fleet of autonomous Trucks have fully evolved land freight. TuSimple is leading the way by hiring the most talented researchers, engineers, and scientists.

TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple has created the first commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview

The Senior HR Data Analyst II, is a data oriented HR professional who builds scalable data foundations at TuSimple, which deliver critical insights and allow for solutions to be created and executed on. He or she helps to create and implement the people analytics roadmap from infrastructure to advanced analytics, and provides input on data reliability, refresh rates, and HRIS functionality. The Senior Data Analyst II collects, compiles, and analyzes comprehensive HR data, metrics, and statistics, for required reporting, and to provide data summaries and analysis in order to support leadership with making people decisions related to retention, salary budget, recruitment, and legal compliance.

They are adept at using various data software and tools, and know how to capture and display impactful root-cause and predictive information in ways that resonate with their audience.

Role Responsibilities
In accordance with TuSimple's objectives and policies and employment laws and legislation, develops and implements advanced and overarching data analyses, data collection methodologies, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality of critical HR data.
Collects and compiles HR people data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS).
Owns all HR people data reporting such as monthly headcount, headcount projection, turnover and attrition, payroll, and employee data changes.
Creates and maintains visualization tools, including dashboards, and obtains feedback on usability and functionality. Ensures data can be leveraged at the level required to draw insights.
Maintains the quality and consistency of HRIS database information; analyzes current data processes and needs, makes recommendations for, and implements data system improvements.
Conducts periodic audits to ensure data consistency and reliability among multiple tools and data sources; provides suggestions for automation of processes (e.g., scripts); identifies discrepancies and suggests solutions and revised data ownership; helps track on-going improvements to mitigate future risks.
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. Develops people metric insights and creates methods for root cause and predictive analysis.
Assists in coaching and knowledge sharing with Business HR and HR Operations in order to move into a more data-driven function. Provides support on the best way to use reports and other HR tools and technologies.
Assists in the process cycles for merit increases and bonus disbursements; reviews proposed salary increases and bonus payouts.
Creates standard management reporting capturing all People Analytics for periodic/quarterly/annual distribution.
Contributes to a data-driven culture, and mentors more junior members of the broader HR team in regards to data processes.
Experience & Skills Required
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Statistics, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or Human Resources, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in reporting and data analytics, including 2+ years working in an HR capacity/environment
Deep statistical, qualitative, and quantitative analysis skills, with the proven ability to utilize data to influence decisions.
Strong ability to perform advanced formulas, power query, tables, conditional formatting, complex pivot tables, VBA and macros.
Strong understanding of applicable data sources, tables, and data relationships.
Experience developing and maintaining data in a relational database environment, such as SQL Server DBA 2005 or later versions.
Previous experience with Paycom, Dayforce, Workday or other HRIS systems.
Advanced MS and/or Google Suite skills; ability to build, maintain, and optimize complex spreadsheets and meaningful presentations.
Experience visualizing data and communicating complex information to technical and non-technical audiences; strong foundation in using statistical and data visualization tools (e.g. SPSS, r. Tableau, Python, PowerBI, etc.)
Solid working knowledge of Human Resources policies, procedures and best practices, including solid knowledge of Federal, State and local employment laws.
Proven ability to de-construct complex data, concepts, and issues, translating into concise recommendations that successfully navigate to resolution, in an organized and methodical framework.
Strong analytical execution with thoroughness, accuracy, and focus on data integrity.
Strong database management skills including the ability to merge, clean and analyze large amounts of data.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent executive presentation skills: ability to extract, analyze and present actionable information from complex research.
Able to identify risks and opportunities, brainstorm innovative solutions, and drive actions to quick resolution

Behavioral Competencies

Strong ability to actively seek opportunities to consult, influence, build and sustain successful relationships and gain alignment with peers, functional partners and/or external partners to accomplish business objectives.
Develops new insights into situations; questions conventional approaches; encourages new ideas and innovations; designs and implements new or cutting-edge programs and processes. Ability to generate and/or recognize imaginative or creative solutions that generate successful outcomes.
Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to appropriately communicate with a wide range of individual constituencies in a diverse community. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing, including translating technical language to a non-technical nature.
Works independently and fosters a cooperative spirit within a large and/or small team of diverse cultures, while working in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines and frequently changing priorities
Entrepreneurial self-starter, with proven ability to effectively work in ambiguous environments and support continuous improvement.
 Intellectually curious with a strong bias to action.
Data-driven, fact-based decision maker with established understanding of business implication.
Highly resourceful, a demonstrated history of independently locating information and resources necessary to accomplish objectives.
Ability to quickly build trust and rapport with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.
 Strong presentation skills with the ability to confidently present to senior management, the Board of Directors, and outside partners.
Comfortable working in an evolving and growing environment that is prone to changes, and managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Demonstrated experience building and improving processes and promoting quality.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple concurrent assignments while meeting deadlines and demanding quality execution.
 Proven ability to work in a matrix organization, tech start-up experience preferred.
Proven ability to maintain steady leadership throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progresive start-up environments.

Preferred Skills and Experience

Preferred Master's in Business Administration, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or Human Resources, or a related field.
