Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love

This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential

Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.

Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Lead Business Analyst (Salesforce) in San Diego, CA.

Responsibilities of the Lead Business Analyst:

Lead Business Analyst will lead meetings with business stakeholders, project sponsors, and program team to identify and document business needs, stakeholder requirements, functional, non-functional and transitional requirements
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Facilitate confirmation of requirements and designs with business and technical team
Conduct user research, draft user stories and meet with product owners to validate, enhance, and prioritize them
Lead Business Analyst will facilitate backlog refinement, roadmap planning and prioritization sessions with product sponsors, stakeholders, and technical staff
Evaluate different solution approaches and recommend solutions that provides business value

Lead Business Analyst will research, review, and analyze the effectiveness of existing requirements gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or furthering these processes

Mentor, coach, and/or manage more junior Analysts on the team
Participate in and/or lead Center of Excellence for BA's/PO's
Lead Business Analyst will conduct weekly meetings to provide status updates and determine priorities
Collaborate deeply with Product owners, Stakeholders, Business Analysts, Developers, Test Engineers, and cross-functional teams to lead end to end delivery
Lead Business Analyst proactively contribute to the quality of the product by seeking and proposing new or alternate approaches to address the requirements

REQUIREMENTS:
Candidates qualifying for this position will have similar experience along with the skills and abilities to perform the duties mentioned. Any relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
The primary purpose of this position is to obtain, provide, analyze and evaluate data to support the financial and operational decisions of the Rite Aid Pharmacy department.

Analyze pharmacy data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Effectively compile and communicate findings to leadership or stakeholders verbally, visually, and in writing (presentation format).
Solve complex analytical and data problems while prioritizing and managing multiple tasks.
Serve as a knowledge resource concerning data analytics tools and data structures for Pharmacy Services.
Adaptable, open to change, and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.

On-Board was founded in 1976 by Robert L. Wilson to provide Engineering and Design services to the chemical manufacturing industry. Today, On-Board is a thriving privately held family of companies with services including: Consulting, Professional Engineering, Industrial Maintenance and Facility Management, Contracted Manufacturing and Production Services, as well as Temporary Staffing and Recruiting throughout North America.
The On-Board Family of Companies conducts operations through its Corporate Headquarters located in East Windsor, NJ along with Regional Offices in New Castle, DE and Wake Forest, NC. On-Board’s Mission is to provide “Flexible Service by applying the talents of our people, work processes and technology to meet our clients’ expectations in a Safe, Responsible and Dependable manner.”

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ.

You can apply to the job with this email address:pmo__quality_engineering___sr__project_analyst_86a31f482us@ivy.greenhouse.io

Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous Trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.


Opportunity Overview

TuSimple's Senior Project Analyst provides overall technical and program management support for assigned projects/programs. The Senior Project Analyst creates and maintains project/program documentation, prepares short-term look ahead schedules, monitors and analyzes project/program risk and coordinates project/program activities, as assigned.

Join us and be a part of excellence!


Role Responsibilities

With basic direction, works with project leads, prepares and updates detailed project plans, deliverable timelines, KPIs and milestones.
Conducts workload planning, tracking and forecasting. Proposes streamlines to workflows.
Evaluates potential project risks and recommends solutions.
Researches, monitors, and analyzes data to provide business insights.
Effectively collaborates with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to monitor project KPIs, proactively overcome project challenges and assist with risk mitigation. Ensures project team members meet assigned project deliverables and deadlines. Escalates updates and information as necessary.
Coordinates, tracks and maintains all project documentation, including project plans and objectives, deliverables, timelines, resource plans, communications, and meeting minutes. Updates documentation, as necessary.
Coordinates and facilitates meetings. Prepares agendas, presentations and all other necessary meeting materials. Takes meeting minutes and distributes accordingly.
Updates and maintains project related pages, dashboards and other relevant data.
Gathers and integrates project performance and progress information. Prepares detailed status reports which include: latest accomplishments, upcoming deliverables, project metrics and risk analysis.
Provides recommendations for improving internal processes and documents all approved process changes.
Manages and enhances existing controlled documentation programs.
Manage quality of change implementation plans while optimizing implementation cost and planning.
Manage quality of impact analysis of changes, to minimize processing time and reliable planning.
Organize and chair cross sector project change control board for impact analysis, planning and disposition of changes
Recognize and advise on scope of change requests (scope control, new or update change)
Coordinate and coach cross-sector project team on the product change process
Monitor and control the implementation of approved changes.
Monitor and give feedback on changes being processed according to agreed policy.
Be involved in embedding improvements delivered from the roadmap on operational level.
Contribute to development of TuSimple quality systems.
Manages the distribution of documentation to approved groups (i.e. Sourcing, Service, Production, etc.).
Assigns new part numbers, creates, and maintains accuracy of manufacturing business systems Bill of Materials (BOM)
Proven ability to effectively support several projects or a full program, simultaneously.
Ability to read and understand a project and program plans. Ability to draft a 3 week look-ahead schedule requiring only minor edits.
Ability to understand project or program documentation, work with source owners to effectively maintain and update, per agreed processes.
Demonstrated ability to effectively influence for routine project needs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Capable of listening and obtaining clarification, adapting approach or method to best fit the situation.
Strong interpersonal skills; capable of collaborating with multiple stakeholders, understanding and interpreting stakeholder needs .
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team; capable of effectively interacting with technical staff.
Strong organizational skills, ability to coordinate multiple tasks and support projects of varying complexity concurrently.
Demonstrated excellence with planning, time-management, prioritization and successful execution of multiple simultaneous assignments.
Proven ability to work under firm deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to maintain steady professionalism throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progressive start-up environments.


Experience & Skills Required

Associate's Degree or above in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
2+ years of Project Coordination or Project Analyst experience.
5+ years of work experience of with at least 2 year's experience in new product introductions or configuration management
Requires combination of specialist (Configuration Management) and project management skills
Appliance of organizational change management techniques
Proven analytical and conceptual skills combined with business sense
Know upstream impact of changes (e.g. logistics, operation, customer support)
Proven experience in managing multiple changes, configurations and their dependencies
Configuration Management certification (CMII module 1-6) is preferred
Personal skills
Natural leader in providing structure, prioritization and decisiveness
Persistent and persuasive towards results in an emphatic and pragmatic manner
Convincing, pro-active attitude and drive for improvement
Sensitive on value of relations: entrepreneur, coalition former, networker, good facilitator
Create learning situations and give feedback to achieve effective behavior from a team
Strong communicator to influence without power
Eager to learn and ability to self-reflect
Adapts and adopts change

100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you and your family
Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Learning/education budget
Employer-paid life insurance
Employer-paid long and short disability

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements

We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

A role you will love

Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Experience with Investor Reporting.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

About Movoto Real Estate

Movoto Real Estate was founded on a simple principle: Real estate should be easy.

This foundational idea continues to drive our mission every day, building cutting-edge, optimized technology tools and connecting talented, customer-focused agents with motivated buyers and sellers. Today, we are the fastest-growing top five residential real estate site in the United States with nearly 26 million monthly visits. But we are more than a real estate brokerage and research site—we're a technology company that is bringing real estate into the future with our end-to-end suite of proprietary tools for buyers, sellers, and agents.

Combining OJO and Movoto's deep commitment to creating end-to-end home-buying solutions, we continue to strive to become the most trusted real estate company in North America. Our real estate technology platform comprises the latest data-driven AI technology, client communication tools, marketing and transaction support, a real team of dedicated transaction coordinators, and an agent earnings structure that ensures our agents are successful and can focus on serving their clients.

Movoto is not only committed to making real estate accessible to a diverse community through technology, we strive to increase representation—across all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, sexual orientations, and physical or mental abilities—in our teams. We continue to promote an inclusive work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.

Together with OJO and our growing team, we have renewed our dedication to the mission that started it all: making real estate easy in this rapidly changing world.

Description
Job Description:
Leidos is currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst to support the Deployment Health Research Department at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA. This position will support the Department of Defense (DoD) Birth and Infant Health Research (BIHR) team in their goal to examine reproductive health outcomes among military families and explore possible relationships between military service and reproductive health. The BIHR databases include large consolidations of DoD administrative and medical data, which are used to identify pregnancies and births among military families and define maternal and infant health outcomes. The Data Analyst will work closely and collaboratively with senior BIHR staff to support efforts across the full research project cycle.
Due the COVID-19 pandemic, employees are highly encouraged to work remotely from their home office, although occasional visits to the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego will be required.
Position Responsibilities
Access various secondary data sources to extract relevant data and construct comprehensive, project-specific datasets
Contribute to data management processes, including data verification, cleaning, quality assurance, merging, and preparing data requests
Develop algorithms to define health outcomes based on medical codes
Use SAS to clean and analyze data and run statistical models including PROC LOGISTIC, REG, PHREG, FREQ, GLM, PROC SQL and more
Prepare tables and graphs displaying research findings
Maintain and update documentation on all processes and procedures, including data dictionaries and codebooks
Contribute to the preparation of study deliverables, including presentations, reports, and publications
Required Qualifications:
Master’s degree in public health, epidemiology, or related field
1-5 years’ work experience in public health, epidemiology, statistics or related field
Experience with research design and statistical methodology for relevant research studies
SAS competency with complex database management and data merging, cleaning and verification processes
Due to federal contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and able to obtain a Secret Clearance.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with or exposure to ICD-9/ICD-10 diagnostic coding and administrative medical claims data
Experience in maternal and infant health research
Experience using SAS to execute advanced analytic techniques (e.g., propensity score analyses)
Pay Range:

Overview
Intuit QuickBooks is on a mission to transform financial services for small businesses through its money movement & lending platform. To deliver on this initiative, we are expanding our Fraud Policy team that focuses on building AI driven controls to detect and prevent fraud in the ecosystem as well as minimizing impact to good customers. We are part of the Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG), focused on preventing fraud across all fintech products. We are seeking a Senior Risk Analyst that will work across multiple functions like Risk Operations, Decision Science, Product, Engineering, Finance & Compliance to design and drive fraud mitigation risk strategies. If you have passion for fraud mitigation and love solving real customer problems through analytics and data science, we welcome you to join our talented team.
This role will focus on risk policy development for our Capital & Lending products and other new Fintech products. Responsibilities will focus on fraud detection and prevention, but elements of credit risk management may also be expected. The lead is responsible for driving fraud risk aspects of business initiatives as well as respond to fraud-related events and demands. Successful candidates for this role will leverage fraud risk expertise, financial analytics and innovative risk strategies to enable Intuit’s SMB growth and expansion, achieve optimal profitability, and enhance trust-related business and consumer experience.
Come join the Strategic Risk team as a Senior Business Data Analyst, Fraud Risk.
What you'll bring
Strong business acumen with a 1.5+ years’ work experience in related field/position.
Bachelor degree in Business, Math, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field, or equivalent experience. MBA or graduate degree in a related field a plus.
Worked in diverse and challenging environment to drive growth, customer experience and profitability.
Ability to manage and lead across highly cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with and understand technical subjects and emerging technologies.
Experience in statistical analysis and adept in tools such as SQL, Python, R, SAS, Excel
Domain expertise in payments and risk management is ideal for this role
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and be responsive and available during times of peak fraud activity.
Strong organization and time management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Understanding of Data Science modelling concepts is a plus
How you will lead
Ability to analyze & research large data sets and translate insights into risk and business opportunities/requirements
Test into and recommend 3rd party data providers that solve for Consumer Fraud, Business Fraud, Email/Device/IP etc. to detect & prevent fraud on platform
Design and scale risk processes to cover an increasingly large and complex landscape of small business risks given our rapidly expanding user base
Design, implement, and monitor experiments to explore new methodologies and estimate key metrics for risk policy effectiveness and efficiency
Ability to perform quantitative and business trade off decisions and create policies to prevent fraud in payments and payroll
Deliver ideas and insights as you collaborate with partner teams, such as engineering, data science & operations to build risk detection systems that drives overall efficiency, customer experience and agent investigation capabilities
Effectively communicate fraud strategy and results to the leadership team
Effectively able to work with product and technology teams to build risk solutions and partner with risk operations to operationalize solutions and get feedback.
In addition, the candidate should bring a high level of enthusiasm to the projects and the ability to organize and motivate large groups. This includes taking initiative, ownership and responsibility for a project
Must have good judgement with the ability to think creatively and strategically

Location. Remote – United States

EXPERIENCE, SKILL and ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:

5 years of experience in Financial or Operational Analysis required.
1-3 years of supervisory experience required.

Experience with a computer programming language such as XML, SQL, HTML or PHP required.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
The primary purpose of this position is to obtain, provide, analyze and evaluate data to support the financial and operational decisions of the Rite Aid Pharmacy department.

Mine prescription claims level data, build queries, and maintain analyses, models, or dashboards to support initiatives, pharmacy planning/forecasting/financial reporting, and process optimization.
Evaluate and analyze the business impact of Agency/Managed Care contracts/reimbursement rate amendments and provide management with the necessary reporting to assist in decision making.
Implement continuous monitoring procedures for payer contracts to identify problematic performance, supplemented with actionable levels of supporting detail.
Analyze pharmacy data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Effectively compile and communicate findings to leadership or stakeholders verbally, visually, and in writing (presentation format).
Solve complex analytical and data problems while prioritizing and managing multiple tasks.
Serve as a knowledge resource concerning data analytics tools and data structures for Pharmacy Services.
Adaptable, open to change, and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Description
Job Description:
The Health and Behavioral Sciences Department at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA has an immediate opening for a full-time Data Analyst/Research Scientist 2 to support an on-going project that involves working with a large, complex longitudinal military population database. This position will provide research and analytic expertise for a project that will modernize the existing U.S. Navy Search and Rescue (SAR) database and examine gaps in en route care (ERC). The successful candidate will work closely and collaboratively with the Principal Investigator, analysts, and subject matter experts to build, maintain, and analyze a large longitudinal database to explore potential gaps in existing maritime ERC. The candidate must be prepared to work independently to complete discrete tasks, with minimal supervision, but should also be comfortable working as part of a larger research team. The successful applicant will have demonstrated excellent interpersonal skills to successfully interact with a variety of people. The ideal candidate will possess strong verbal, written, and analytical skills; be organized and detail-orientated; demonstrate project management skills, including the ability to determine appropriate priorities and complete projects accurately, on-time, and within budget; able to take initiative, and work well independently and as part of a team.
Due the COVID-19 pandemic, employees are highly encouraged to work remotely from their home office, although occasional visits to the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego will be required. Longer term, this position will be required to be on-site at the Naval Health Research Center a minimum of 2 days a week.
Primary Responsibilities:
Participates in all aspects of the research process including survey design, data collection and management, and data analysis and interpretation.
Provides research and analytic support for study design, implementation, and analyses of deployment health research projects, with a focus on chronic disease, environmental, and/or occupational epidemiology.
Develops protocols and proposals including conducting literature reviews and writing of the scientific background, study methodology, and data analyses. Additionally, writes the interpretation of data findings in the context of ongoing research objectives and publishes findings.
Develops algorithms and writes programs to clean, merge, and update variables/datasets from large epidemiologic studies. Runs programs to create final datasets for this large study program ensuring accuracy. Familiarity working with medical record data strongly preferred.
Performs and helps interpret statistical analyses using SAS, SPSS, R and/or STATA including data manipulations, weighting techniques, logistic regression, general linear models with repeated measures, survival analyses, and other statistical techniques for longitudinal and missing data.
Writes reports and scientific manuscripts for peer-reviewed professional journals.
Delivers presentations to the Department and at various national and international scientific and military conferences.
Required Qualifications:
Master’s degree in statistics or relevant social science field (e.g., epidemiology, public health, psychology) with heavy quant focus and at least 4 years of significant research experience with large, complex medical records datasets
Experience using applied statistics in a professional research capacity using large, complex longitudinal datasets
Demonstrated expertise in SAS, SPSS, R, STATA, or other statistical packages
Demonstrated expertise with data manipulation, data analysis (including linear and logistic regression, hazard models, data visualization
Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated familiarity with the Military Health System Data Repository and/or other large complex military databases
Demonstrated experience preparing military research documents, including military data-sharing agreements and IRB protocols
Demonstrated experience with natural language processing and machine learning
Demonstrated ability to conceptualize and write complex documents such as project reports, technical reports, and manuscripts for peer-reviewed publication
Due to federal contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and able to obtain a Secret Clearance.
Pay Range:
#Remote

Description
Job Description:
Leidos is currently seeking a full-time Data Analyst to support the Deployment Health Research Department at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA. This position will support the Department of Defense (DoD) Birth and Infant Health Research (BIHR) team in their goal to examine reproductive health outcomes among military families and explore possible relationships between military service and reproductive health. The BIHR databases include large consolidations of DoD administrative and medical data, which are used to identify pregnancies and births among military families and define maternal and infant health outcomes. The Data Analyst will work closely and collaboratively with senior BIHR staff to support efforts across the full research project cycle.
Due the COVID-19 pandemic, employees are highly encouraged to work remotely from their home office, although occasional visits to the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego will be required.
Position Responsibilities
Access various secondary data sources to extract relevant data and construct comprehensive, project-specific datasets
Contribute to data management processes, including data verification, cleaning, quality assurance, merging, and preparing data requests
Develop algorithms to define health outcomes based on medical codes
Use SAS to clean and analyze data and run statistical models including PROC LOGISTIC, REG, PHREG, FREQ, GLM, PROC SQL and more
Prepare tables and graphs displaying research findings
Maintain and update documentation on all processes and procedures, including data dictionaries and codebooks
Contribute to the preparation of study deliverables, including presentations, reports, and publications
Required Qualifications:
Master’s degree in public health, epidemiology, or related field
1-5 years’ work experience in public health, epidemiology, statistics or related field
Experience with research design and statistical methodology for relevant research studies
SAS competency with complex database management and data merging, cleaning and verification processes
Due to federal contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and able to obtain a Secret Clearance.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with or exposure to ICD-9/ICD-10 diagnostic coding and administrative medical claims data
Experience in maternal and infant health research
Experience using SAS to execute advanced analytic techniques (e.g., propensity score analyses)
Pay Range:
